reasoning: Rare cause of hypercalcemia, now uncommon since decline of milk-alkali peptic ulcer therapy. Still occurs with excessive calcium supplementation. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on case series.
source: Picolos DK et al. (2005). Milk-alkali syndrome is a major cause of hypercalcaemia among non-end-stage renal disease (non-ESRD) inpatients. Clin Endocrinol. 63(5):566-76
